programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 12 seed Texas Tech (48-12) went 3-0 to win the Lubbock Regional last weekend; No. 5 seed Florida State (49-10) is 1-1 all-time against the Red Raiders after earning a 9-8 victory in the 2024 FSU Tournament, as Riley Love homered twice.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived to showcase some of the top performances from the best fighters in the organization, the more impressive knockouts to occur in the Octagon, and the top upsets that shocked the UFC.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 11 seed Houston (29-24) makes its Big 12 Baseball Championship debut this season; No. 6 seed Kansas State (31-23), which is 14-18 all-time in the tournament, won two of three meetings with the Cougars at home during the regular season.

programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Georgia (34-21) beat No. 14 seed Duke in the Durham Regional with a 5-2 victory in eight innings on May 18; No. 3 seed Florida (46-14) has won five of the past seven meetings, including a 9-4 victory in the quarterfinals of the 2024 SEC Tournament.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 11 seed Clemson (47-12) advanced to its third Super Regional in program history with a 5-1 victory over Kentucky on May 18; No. 6 seed Texas (49-10) won the inaugural encounter vs. the Tigers with a 4-0 victory in the 2022 FGCU Kickoff Classic.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Host and No. 5 seed Florida State faces No. 12 seed Texas Tech in Game 2 of their best-of-three matchup with the winner advancing to Oklahoma City to play in the 2025 Women's College World Series; Texas Tech seeks its first-ever WCWS appearance.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Nebraska (42-13) secured its first appearance in a Super Regional since 2014 after defeating SE Louisiana, 8-0, in six innings in the Baton Rouge Regional on May 18; No. 7 seed Tennessee (43-14) is 5-2 all-time against the Cornhuskers.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Monaco; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 15 seed Alabama (40-21) won two of three meetings with the Sooners during the regular season; No. 2 seed Oklahoma (48-7), the four-time defending national champion, seeks its ninth consecutive appearance in the Women's College World Series.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 9 seed UCLA (52-10), which leads all programs with 12 national titles, outscored its opponents in the Los Angeles Regional, 31-2; No. 8 seed South Carolina (43-15) seeks its first Women's College World Series appearance since 1997.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: The Buddy Way
programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The top 10 European fighters in UFC history are examined and profiled, showcasing how these hard-hitting brawlers carved their names into the annals of legend; highlights share how these battle-hardened combatants cemented their legacies.

programme.title: Lacrosse
programme.desc: Saskatchewan avoided elimination with an 11-10 win over Buffalo in Game 2 behind three goals and five assists from Austin Shanks, along with six points from Zach Manns; Dhane Smith led the Bandits with two goals and three assists in the loss.

programme.title: Sport Fishing TV
programme.desc: Sport Fishing magazine's executive editor, award-winning marine journalist and host John Brownlee goes to exotic locations around the world to showcase abundant fisheries during their peak seasons and focusing on specific species.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Monaco Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Charles Leclerc finished with a 70.27-second lap time last year to win his second pole before winning the race.

programme.title: This is Football
programme.desc: Kevin Clark breaks down the latest across the NFL world, discussing the recent news making headlines, recapping games from the previous week, previewing upcoming matchups and interviews guests to gain a unique perspective on topics.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Host and No. 6 seed Texas takes on No. 11 seed Clemson in Game 2 of their best-of-three matchup with the winner advancing to Oklahoma City to play in the 2025 Women's College World Series; Tigers seek their maiden WCWS appearance in program history.

programme.title: College Lacrosse
programme.desc: No. 6 seed Syracuse upset No. 3 seed Princeton, 19-18, to advance; No. 2 seed Maryland beat Georgetown, 9-6, and won its last seven meetings with the Orange after an 11-7 victory on Feb. 15 behind two goals and two assists from Eric Spanos.

programme.title: Sportsman's Adventures with Captain Rick Murphy
programme.desc: Captain Rick Murphy, the all-time winningest saltwater tournament angler in the United States, who boats 139 titles to date, goes fishing with a wide variety of passionate anglers in a multitude of thriving fishing holes.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Monaco; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: College Lacrosse
programme.desc: No. 5 seed Penn State beat Notre Dame, 14-12, and won its season meeting with the Big Red, 13-12, in overtime on March 8 behind an Ethan Long game-winner; No. 1 seed Cornell made it 12-straight wins with a 13-12 victory over Richmond.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano, who won his second All-Star Race last year over Denny Hamlin, and Ryan Blaney headline the field of 20-plus drivers competing in the 200-lap race at the 0.625-mile oval for a $1 million prize.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.desc: Rookie Brenden Queen secured his second win this season, first since the opener at Daytona, with his victory at Kansas over William Sawalich; Tanner Gray averaged 103.409 mph en route to his win at Charlotte last year over Carson Kvapil.

programme.desc: Michigan (5-2) won its last two games after a 25-24 win over Arlington behind a Toa Taua rushing touchdown as time expired, and won both meetings with the Roughnecks last season; Houston (3-4) had its two-win streak snapped by Birmingham, 33-25.

programme.title: 2025 Senior PGA Championship
programme.desc: England's Richard Bland finished at 13-under before defeating Hiroyuki Fujita of Japan in a playoff in last year's edition of the tournament; Bland, Miguel Ángel Jiménez, Steven Alker, Ernie Els, Stewart Cink and Angel Cabrera are among the field.

programme.title: College Golf
programme.desc: Stanford, which is the top overall seed for the third year in a row, won the team title for the second time in three years and secured its third crown in program history after defeating UCLA in the final of last year's edition of the tournament, 3-2.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $9.5 million purse, debuted in 1946 and has been played at Colonial Country Club since its inception; Ben Hogan, who won the first two editions of the tournament (1946-47), owns the tournament record with five titles.
